DESCRIPTION: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.

Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.
A genomic assay that profiles the microorganisms present in a sample.
An assay that investigates the genome or genomes of an individual organism or population of organisms.
A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.
A disease involving the reproductive system.
A disease is a disposition to undergo pathological processes that exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.
A process experienced by the patient, which can only be experienced by the patient, that is hypothesized to be clinically relevant.
A condition or physical state produced by the ingestion, injection, inhalation of or exposure to a deleterious agent.

An assay which generates data about a genotype from a specimen of genomic DNA. A variety of techniques and instruments can be used to produce information about sequence variation at particular genomic positions.
A material processing which prepares a biosample for investigation.
A disease involving the endocrine system.
A count of the number of biosamples collected for an investigation.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
A genomic assay that identifies genetic loci and candidate genes correlated with phenotypes.

A drug administration description that specifies a drug administration prescribed or reported by an healthcare provider. It specifies: - The drug product - The posology It may also specify a starting drug administration condition
A clinical history that is about the prescription drugs taken by an individual.
A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information on the DNA sequences of multiple genomes (a metagenome) from different organisms present in the same input sample.
A disease involving the cardiovascular system.

TERM: diseases of the ear, nose, and/or throat
DESCRIPTION: Pathological processes of the ear, the nose, and the throat, also known as the ENT diseases.
an information content entity that is about a part of a health care encounter that occurs in a hospital facility
An information content entity about healthcare that is private or public.
A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.
A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A disease involving the integumental system.
A geographical location in which an individual was born.
A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.
An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's identification with a group of other individuals on the basis of presumed similarities such as language or common ancestry.
An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's preference towards a range of characteristics pertaining to, and differentiating between, masculinity and femininity.
A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.
A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).
A lifestyle history that is about the typical physical activity of an individual.
A clinical history that is about the lifestyle and behaviors of an individual which may impact health outcomes.
A lifestyle history that is about the use of unprescribed and/or non-prescription drugs.
A lifestyle history that is about the alcohol consumption of an individual.

TERM: summary statistics for additional data from federated sources
DESCRIPTION: A statistic that summarizes a set of federated data.
A lifestyle history that is about the tobacco use or exposure of an individual.
A disease involving the hematopoietic system.

A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.
Information that is about the structure of an individual's family and/or household.
An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virute of the bearer's highest level of formal education completed.
An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.
A geographical location in which an individual currently resides.
An assay that produces a picture of an entity.
A disease involving the renal system.
Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus[MW,modified]
Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.
An transcription profiling assay that determines an RNA sequence by analyzing the transcibed regions of the genome and or to quantitate transcript abundance.
An identifier that is guaranteed to be unique among all identifiers in a particular domain.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the brain, spinal cord, or peripheral nerves.
A disease involving the musculoskeletal system.
A quality which inheres in a population of organisms.
Information about an individual's use of assistive devices in performing daily activities.

TERM: perception of health and quality of life

DESCRIPTION: A sample size that is about the count of individual organisms in a population.
A data item that is about a population of organisms.
Information that is about an individual's limitations in activities that involve caring for an moving the body.
A population data item that is about the geographical location of a population of organisms.
A psychological measurement of an individual's perception of their quality of life.
Excretion that is the output of a kidney
A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.
environmental system associated with the dwelling used by humans.

TERM: criteria for enrollment and recruitment procedures
DESCRIPTION: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion* which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.
A psychological measurement of an individual's subjective perception of health.
A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about physical therapy treatments such as physical rehabilitation.
A treatment history that is about any non-pharamacological treatments such as surgery or physical therapy.
A directive information entity that specifies the sequence in which a series of events occurred or will occur.
A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about use of radiology for treatment of disease, disorder, or symptom.
A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about psychological treatments such as counselling.
A lifestyle history that is about oral health and hygiene.
A biological process that results from neurophysiological changes in response to internal and external events.
A measurement datum of some aspect of human psychology.
A psychological measurement of a person's individual sets of behaviours, cognitions, and emotional patterns.
A disease that has its basis in the disruption of mental process.
A psychological measurement of some aspect of intellectual functions such as memory, problem solving, and comprehension.
An information content entity that is about an activity that realizes a social role and is often performed for payment.
A textual entity that contains contact details for an individual's physician, which may include: name, phone number, address, etc.
A lifestyle history that is about the diet and nutrition of an individual.
A lifestyle history that is about the sleep quality and duration of an individual.
A clinical history that is about pregnancy, maternity, fertility, menses, and any other reproductive aspect.
An availability textual entity that is about a substance from an organism (a biosample).
An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.
A health care prescription specifying the initiation, modification or cessation of a drug administration.

A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system. Representative examples include pneumonia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, pulmonary failure, lung adenoma, lung carcinoma, and tracheal carcinoma.
a data item that is about an investigation and is the specified output of a data transformation that has only clinical visit data as input
An information content entity indicating the cause of death for a participant in the study.
A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.
A disorder that is present at birth due to genetics or environmental factors during development.
A disease that involves the visual system.
An assay that identifies the organism species in a specimen.
A storage process for a biosample collected from an organism.
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the Clinical Dementia Rating Scale.
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the Neuropsychiatric Inventory.
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the Severe Impairment Battery.
A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

A directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.
a categorical value specification that is about a human being and specifies whether that human being is joined to another human being in marriage
Blood that is collected from an organism which has been fasting for a given amount of time.
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the Penn Computerized Neurocognitive Battery.

An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the CERAD Neurophyschological Battery.
A biological process that results from a drug stimulus.
Information that is about the disease treated by a drug prescribed to an individual.
A clinical history that is about surgical operations performed on an individual.
A disease or disorder that involves the digestive system.
A cognitive measurement that is the output (score) from the Montreal Cognitive Assessment Test (MoCA) for Dementia
Information about the language an individual has been exposed to from birth and is their first language.
A cognitive measurement that is an output (score) from the Mini-Mental State Exam.
A cognitive measurement that is an output (score) from the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale.
A planned process that is a part of an investigation in which raw data is collected.
A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about diagnostic procedures to determine a condition or disease.
A population quality concerning the age range of a population.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
A clinical history that is about any family history of disease.
A population quality concerning the gender or genders of the population.
An immaterial entity that encompasses the domain made up of interactions between the individual's physical environment, social processes, and relationships with other individuals and groups.
A population quality concerning the sex or sexes of the population.
Information about an individual's association with a religion, denomiation, or sub- or non-denominational religious group.
